config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are ``AVRO``, ``JSON_SR``, or ``PROTOBUF``. Ensure you configure the Confluent Cloud Schema Registry for such schema-based message formats.

config_defs.name: servicenow.url
config_defs.documentation: ServiceNow instance URL. For example: `https://${instance-id}.service-now.com/`.

config_defs.name: auth.type
config_defs.documentation: The authentication type of the endpoint. Valid values are ``BASIC`` or ``OAUTH2``.

config_defs.name: connection.user
config_defs.documentation: The username for an endpoint requiring basic authentication.

config_defs.name: connection.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for an endpoint requiring basic authentication.

config_defs.name: oauth2.token.url
config_defs.documentation: The URL for fetching OAuth2 token. Supported grant type is Client Credentials.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.id
config_defs.documentation: The client ID for fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.secret
config_defs.documentation: The client secret for fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.token.property
config_defs.documentation: The name of the property that contains the OAuth2 token returned by the OAuth2 token URL (defaults to `access_token`).

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.scope
config_defs.documentation: The scope parameter sent to the service when fetching the OAuth2 token.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: The encoding method of the ``client_id`` and ``client_secret`` in an OAuth2 authorization request. If set to ``header``, the credentials are encoded as an `Authorization: Basic <base-64 encoded client_id:client_secret>` HTTP header. If set to `url`, the credentials are sent as URL-encoded parameters.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.headers
config_defs.documentation: HTTP headers that should be included in the OAuth2 client endpoint. Individual headers must be separated by a `|`.

config_defs.name: oauth2.client.header.separator
config_defs.documentation: The character used as separator in OAuth2 client headers.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Specify whether to generate and add a JWT token to the request. If set to `true`, JWT token will be added as a `jwt_token` request parameter.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.path
config_defs.documentation: The keystore containing the private key used to sign JWTs.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The password to access the keystore.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.keystore.type
config_defs.documentation: The keystore type for signing JWT. Valid values are `JKS` or `PKCS12`.

config_defs.name: oauth2.jwt.claimset
config_defs.documentation: A JSON containing JWT claims for authentication.

config_defs.name: tables.num
config_defs.documentation: The number of tables to fetch data from. This value should be less than or equal to 5.

config_defs.name: behavior.on.error
config_defs.documentation: The error handling behavior setting for handling error response from HTTP requests. Valid values are `FAIL` or `IGNORE`.

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.policy
config_defs.documentation: The backoff policy to use for retry attempts. Valid values are `CONSTANT_VALUE` or `EXPONENTIAL_WITH_JITTER`.

config_defs.name: retry.backoff.ms
config_defs.documentation: The initial wait time in milliseconds after an error before a retry attempt is made. Subsequent backoff attempts can be a constant value or exponential with jitter (set via the `retry.backoff.policy` parameter). Jitter adds randomness to the exponential backoff algorithm to prevent synchronized retries.

config_defs.name: retry.on.status.codes
config_defs.documentation: A comma-separated list of HTTP status codes or a range of codes to retry on. Ranges are specified with a starting code and an optional ending code. The range boundaries are inclusive. For instance, "400-" includes all codes greater than or equal to 400, and "400-500" includes codes from 400 to 500, including 500 itself. Multiple ranges and single codes can be combined for fine-grained control over retry behavior. For example, "404, 408, 500-" will retry on 404 NOT FOUND, 408 REQUEST TIMEOUT, and all 5xx error codes. Note that certain status codes, such as unauthorized, timeouts, and too many requests, will always prompt a retry.

config_defs.name: max.retries
config_defs.documentation: The maximum number of retries on errors before a task is failed.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Determine whether the connection to the endpoint should use SSL.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.keystorefile
config_defs.documentation: The key store containing the server certificate.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.keystore.password
config_defs.documentation: The store password for the key store file.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.key.password
config_defs.documentation: The password for the private key in the key store file.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.truststorefile
config_defs.documentation: The trust store containing a server CA certificate.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.truststore.password
config_defs.documentation: The trust store password containing a server CA certificate.

config_defs.name: servicenow.ssl.protocol
config_defs.documentation: The protocol to use for SSL connections.

config_defs.name: table1.name
config_defs.documentation: The table name, combined with the ServiceNow Instance URL, will form the complete HTTP(S) URL. This path can be templated to include offset information.

config_defs.name: table1.topic
config_defs.documentation: Specify the topic to which data will be pushed for this table.

config_defs.name: table1.batch.size
config_defs.documentation: Size of the batch of records to be fetched from the ServiceNow table. Note that Basic and Standard Clusters may experience throughput limitations, even with a higher batch size.

config_defs.name: table1.start.timestamp
config_defs.documentation: Time to start fetching all updates/creation. Defaults to `1970-01-01 00:00:00`. Note that the time is in UTC and requires format: `yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss`.

config_defs.name: table1.timestamp.field
config_defs.documentation: Timestamp Field to be used for pagination.

config_defs.name: table1.pagination.query
config_defs.documentation: The query to be used for pagination on the table can be templated with offset information - `${offset}`. Note that all other table-related configurations will be ignored if this is configured. It defaults to a timestamp-based pagination query. An example query is `closed_at>=${offset}^ORDERBYclosed_at`, where `${offset}` refers to the pagination query offset field - `closed_at`.

config_defs.name: table1.pagination.query.field
config_defs.documentation: Offset field if pagination query is used.

config_defs.name: table1.display.value
config_defs.documentation: Specify whether to display values for the ServiceNow table records.

config_defs.name: table1.allowlisted.fields
config_defs.documentation: A comma-separated list of fields that should be included in the Kafka record. The list must necessarily include the selected timestamp field (either `sys_updated_on` or `sys_created_on`) and the `sys_id` field. It defaults to all fields from the response.

config_defs.name: table1.request.interval.ms
config_defs.documentation: The time in milliseconds to wait between consecutive requests.

config_defs.name: table1.exclude.reference.link
config_defs.documentation: Indicates whether to exclude Table API links for reference fields. By default, it includes all the Table API links.

config_defs.name: table1.query.category
config_defs.documentation: Name of the category to use for queries.

config_defs.name: table1.count.records
config_defs.documentation: Indicates if a ``SELECT COUNT(*)`` query will run to retrieve the row count on the table. Setting it to ``true`` enables this query.

config_defs.name: table1.query.domain
config_defs.documentation: Indicates whether to restrict the record search to the domains that are accessible to the logged in user . If set to ``true``, it excludes the records from domains that the current logged in user can't access.

config_defs.name: table1.suppress.pagination.header
config_defs.documentation: Indicates whether to remove the Link header from the response. The Link header provides various URLs to relative pages in the record set which you can use to paginate the returned record set.

config_defs.name: connector.class
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?

config_defs.name: name
config_defs.group: How should we connect to your data?
config_defs.documentation: Sets a name for your connector.

config_defs.name: tasks.max
config_defs.group: Number of tasks for this connector
config_defs.documentation: Maximum number of tasks for the connector.

config_defs.name: kafka.auth.mode
config_defs.documentation: Kafka Authentication mode. It can be one of KAFKA_API_KEY or SERVICE_ACCOUNT. It defaults to KAFKA_API_KEY mode.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.key
config_defs.documentation: Kafka API Key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

connector_configs.name: confluent.topic.bootstrap.servers
connector_configs.value: Placeholder value to pass connector validations

config_defs.name: kafka.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: The Service Account that will be used to generate the API keys to communicate with Kafka Cluster.

config_defs.name: kafka.api.secret
config_defs.documentation: Secret associated with Kafka API key. Required when kafka.auth.mode==KAFKA_API_KEY.

config_defs.name: datapreview.schemas.enable
config_defs.display_name: Show schemas in data preview request output
config_defs.documentation:
This config key only applies to data preview requests and governs whether the data preview output has record schema with it.
The visibility condition is set such that it can never be true.
So this key does not show in create connector UI.

config_defs.name: errors.tolerance
config_defs.documentation: Use this property if you would like to configure the connector's error handling behavior. WARNING: This property should be used with CAUTION for SOURCE CONNECTORS as it may lead to dataloss. If you set this property to 'all', the connector will not fail on errant records, but will instead log them (and send to DLQ for Sink Connectors) and continue processing. If you set this property to 'none', the connector task will fail on errant records.

config_defs.name: producer.override.linger.ms
config_defs.documentation: The producer groups together any records that arrive in between request transmissions into a single batched request. More details can be found in the documentation: https://docs.confluent.io/platform/current/installation/configuration/producer-configs.html#linger-ms.

config_defs.name: csfle.enabled
config_defs.documentation: Determines whether the connector honours CSFLE rules or not

config_defs.name: sr.service.account.id
config_defs.documentation: Select the service account that has appropriate permissions to schemas and encryption keys in the Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: schema.context.name
config_defs.documentation: Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

config_defs.name: schema.context.name
config_defs.documentation: Add a schema context name. A schema context represents an independent scope in Schema Registry. It is a separate sub-schema tied to topics in different Kafka clusters that share the same Schema Registry instance. If not used, the connector uses the default schema configured for Schema Registry in your Confluent Cloud environment.

config_defs.name: reporter.error.topic.name
config_defs.documentation: The name of the topic to produce errant records after each unsuccessful API operation. Defaults to 'error-${connector}' if not set. You can provide ``${connector}`` in the value to use it as a placeholder for the logical cluster ID.

config_defs.name: output.data.format
config_defs.documentation: Sets the output Kafka record value format. Valid entries are AVRO, JSON_SR, or PROTOBUF. Please configure Confluent Cloud Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: value.converter.ignore.default.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: When set to true, this property ensures that the corresponding record in Kafka is NULL, instead of showing the default column value. Applicable for AVRO,PROTOBUF and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.scrub.invalid.names
config_defs.documentation: Whether to scrub invalid names by replacing invalid characters with valid characters. Applicable for Avro and Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: auto.restart.on.user.error
config_defs.documentation: Enable connector to automatically restart on user-actionable errors.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.avro.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information and Enums. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.connect.meta.data
config_defs.documentation: Allow the Connect converter to add its metadata to the output schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.enhanced.protobuf.schema.support
config_defs.documentation: Enable enhanced schema support to preserve package information. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.index.for.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate an index suffix for unions. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.int.for.enums
config_defs.documentation: Whether to represent enums as integers. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should be specified with an optional label. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.generate.struct.for.nulls
config_defs.documentation: Whether to generate a struct variable for null values. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.nullables
config_defs.documentation: Whether nullable fields should use primitive wrapper messages. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.wrapper.for.raw.primitives
config_defs.documentation: Whether a wrapper message should be interpreted as a raw primitive at root level. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.object.additional.properties
config_defs.documentation: Whether to allow additional properties for object schemas. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.optional.for.nonrequired
config_defs.documentation: Whether to set non-required properties to be optional. Applicable for JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.decimal.format
config_defs.documentation:
Specify the JSON/JSON_SR serialization format for Connect DECIMAL logical type values with two allowed literals:
BASE64 to serialize DECIMAL logical types as base64 encoded binary data and
NUMERIC to serialize Connect DECIMAL logical type values in JSON/JSON_SR as a number representing the decimal value.

config_defs.name: value.converter.auto.register.schemas
config_defs.documentation: Specify if the Serializer should attempt to register the Schema.

config_defs.name: value.converter.use.latest.version
config_defs.documentation: Use latest version of schema in subject for serialization when auto.register.schemas is false.

config_defs.name: value.converter.latest.compatibility.strict
config_defs.documentation: Verify latest subject version is backward compatible when `use.latest.version` is `true`.

config_defs.name: key.converter.key.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: How to construct the subject name for key schema registration.

config_defs.name: value.converter.value.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Determines how to construct the subject name under which the value schema is registered with Schema Registry.

config_defs.name: value.converter.reference.subject.name.strategy
config_defs.documentation: Set the subject reference name strategy for value. Valid entries are DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy or QualifiedReferenceSubjectNameStrategy. Note that the subject reference name strategy can be selected only for PROTOBUF format with the default strategy being DefaultReferenceSubjectNameStrategy.

config_defs.name: value.converter.allow.optional.map.keys
config_defs.documentation: Allow optional string map key when converting from Connect Schema to Avro Schema. Applicable for Avro Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.singleton.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten singleton unions. Applicable for Avro and JSON_SR Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.optional.for.proto2
config_defs.documentation: Whether proto2 optionals are supported. Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: value.converter.flatten.unions
config_defs.documentation: Whether to flatten unions (oneofs). Applicable for Protobuf Converters.

config_defs.name: header.converter
config_defs.documentation: The converter class for the headers. This is used to serialize and deserialize the headers of the messages.

config_defs.name: producer.override.compression.type
config_defs.documentation: The compression type for all data generated by the producer. Valid values are none, gzip, snappy, lz4, and zstd.
